column4: heya. whats the meaning of the number and letter in the runlevel symlinks? e.g S20 ?
S means it'll be started, K means it'll be stopped. The numbers make sure the scripts are run in the right order.
so S99 means last and K99 first?
Something like that, yes, ExElNeT. It's been a while since I've had to mess with it by hand. :)

bullgard4 thanks... but i have still a problem... i cant start an init script just fine, but if wanna start it automatically on startup it fails... is there any log which would help me finding out why the script fails on bootup?
